intro: Cryptantha clevelandii var. hispidissima, commonly known as Cleveland's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This variety is often found in coastal sage scrub and chaparral habitats.
